MINISTRY OF EDUCATION AND TRAINING NATIONAL ECONOMICS UNIVERSITY | SOCIALIST REPUBLIC OF VIETNAM Independence – Freedom – Happiness
COURSE SYLLABUS
(Promulgated together with the decision No. QD/ĐHKTTQD, 2021)
Program name : Bachelor of Software Engineering

- Title:	English for IT
- Course number:	CNTT1192E
- Type of course:	Compulsory
- Number of credits:	3
+ Theory hours	30
+ Discuss/Practice hours
+ Self-study hours       	15
90
- Prerequisite:	None

Faculty: Department of Information Technology
Address: Room 1310 (Building A1) - NEU, 207 Giai Phong - Hai Ba Trưng district- HN.
Lecturer:
Dr. Đặng Minh Quân | 0364102376 | quandm@neu.edu.vn
Dr. Nguyễn Trung Tuấn | 0913537768 | tuannt@neu.edu.vn

This module provides knowledge to help students understand basic English in the field of information technology and specialized vocabulary, read and understand basic IT documents, discuss in English simple problems of IT with foreigners who use English.
The course equips learners with the necessary knowledge, skills and competencies to search, retrieve and exploit English-language learning resources related to specialized subjects in the training program, and continue to higher education.

Course books:
[1] Eric H Glendinning, John Mcewan (2002) Oxford English for Information Technology, Oxford.
Reference books:
[2] Trần Nga, Hương Giang. Tiếng anh dành cho người sử dụng vi tính. Nhà xuất bản từ điển Bách Khoa 2009
[3] Lê Thành. Tiếng anh dụng vi tính căn bản cho người sử dụng vi tính. Nhà xuất bản đại học sư phạm 2004

Table 5.1. Course Objectives
Index | Course Objectives Description | PLO | Level
[1] | [2] | [3] | [4]
G1 | Provide learners with vocabularies, grammatical structures that are frequently used in IT majors. Introduce learners to how to apply those vocabularies and grammatical structures in different situations such as essay writing, technical exchange, English - Vietnamese, Vietnamese - English translation of specialized technical documents. | PLO 1.4.3 | 3
G2 | Students know how to search for information, find documents in English to refer to in-depth knowledge. Simple academic exchange with English-speaking foreigners. | PLO 2.1.1, PLO 2.3.1, PLO 2.3.2 | 3U, 3U
G3 | The course contributes to the development of the ability to write independent essays as well as the ability to create groups to communicate and exchange professional issues. Initially equipping learners with awareness of social context, awareness of professional ethics, social responsibility in IT field. | PLO 3.1.1, PLO 3.1.2, PLO 3.2.3 | 3, 3, 3

Table 6.1. Course Learning Outcomes
Goal | CLOs | CLOs description* | Level of achievement**
[1] | [2] | [3] | [4]
G1 | CLO1.1 | Explain and translate the meanings of commonly used English words in the IT industry. | 2
G1 | CLO1.2 | Explain the English grammar structures commonly used in IT majors. | 2
G1 | CLO1.3 | Division of application cases of grammatical structures. | 3
G1 | CLO1.4 | Apply vocabulary and grammatical structures in essay writing, communication, and translation. | 4
G2 | CLO2.1 | Have skills in searching, collecting, synthesizing, analyzing and presenting small essays for each specific topic of the major. | 2
G2 | CLO2.2 | Practice communication skills in English practice group | 3
G2 | CLO2.3 | Skilled in using the English language in communication and specialized translation | 3
G3 | CLO3.1 | Ability to self-study, self-study materials to complete assigned lessons and assignments. | 3
G3 | CLO3.2 | Consciously organize class discipline, comply with classroom rules, have a spirit of cooperation and personal responsibility for the activities assigned by the lecturer. | 3
G3 | CLO3.3 | Ability to organize groups and communicate in English practice groups | -

Diligence | Learning attitude in class Answer questions in class Answer discussion questions | Week 1-12 | CLO1.x -CLO3.x | Lecturer's teaching diary with assessment criteria: (i) Level of participation (ii) Level of interaction (iii) Quality of answers | 10%
Assessment of the process | Quik test Individual assignments | Week 3,5,7,10,12 | CLO1.x – CLO3.x | Criteria: (i) Complete and correct assignments (ii) The assignment is completed on time | 40%
Assessment of the process | Midterm exam | Week 8 | CLO1.x, CLO2.3, CLO3.2 | Criteria: (i) The assignment is complete and correct (ii) Nice form (iii) Timely submission of regulations (iv) Comply with the school's regulations on examination and evaluation. | 40%

9. CLASS REGULATION
9.1. Requirement for taking final/terminal exam
- Students are allowed to take the final exam/terminal exam (50%) if their attendance score (10%) reaches 5 points or more (scale of 10).
9.2. Requirement for attending classes
- Students/students are responsible for attending all classes. In case of absence from school due to force majeure, there must be sufficient and reasonable proofs. For each absence, 1 point will be deducted from the process assessment. Students who miss more than 3 classes, with or without reason, will be considered as not completing the course and must re-register.
- Students will be added points for each construction speech, which can be compensated for attendance points and test scores.
9.3. Requirement for in-class behavior
- The course is conducted on the principle of respecting learners and teachers. Any behavior that affects the teaching and learning process is strictly prohibited.
- Students must come to school on time. Students who are late more than 10 minutes after class starts will not be allowed to attend the class.
- Absolutely do not make noise, affecting others during the learning process.
- Absolutely do not eat, chew gum, use devices such as phones, music players during class time.
- Notebooks and tablets are only used for the purpose of taking lecture notes, calculating for lectures and exercises, absolutely not for other purposes.
